channel.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?
channel.description:
What is the best test server/easiest I could use for KDE?
That I can just edit a file right out of a folder and refresh localhost for it to update.

item.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

http://moparisthebest.com/pkgmanager/portage.html

item.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Yeah i’m just using Sabayon with KDE 3.5, Theres no package for it I don’t think.

Is there a way to install xampp with an icon in the menu to start it rather than having to type a command?

Read full topic

item.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Oops, I swore I read kubuntu in there someplace, my bad.

Anyway, a debian based distro should have those packages.

Read full topic
item.source: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?

item.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:246875”]‘sudo apt-get install apache2 libapache2-mod-php5 php5-mysql mysql-server mysql-client’

That should take care of it, by default put your files in /var/www, or change /etc/apache2/sites-available/default to make it whatever you want.[/quote]You’re sure he’s running debian?

Read full topic
item.source: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?

item.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

‘sudo apt-get install apache2 libapache2-mod-php5 php5-mysql mysql-server mysql-client’

That should take care of it, by default put your files in /var/www, or change /etc/apache2/sites-available/default to make it whatever you want.

Read full topic
item.source: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?

item.title: Best Test Server (HTTP, PHP, MySQL) for KDE?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Install apache php and mysql from you package manager and if you distro isn’t shit it should work out of the box.
